intro: Bootia cymosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its compact growth habit makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine arrangements. Bootia cymosa is known for its short flowering period, usually in late spring to early summer.
